metadata.title: CVE-2020-16093 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In LemonLDAP::NG (aka lemonldap-ng) through 2.0.8, validity of the X.509certificate is not checked by default when connecting to remote LDAPbackends, because the default configuration of the Net::LDAPS module forPerl is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.0.9+ds-1
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.0.9+ds-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.9+ds-1').
